title: ISic000234. Fragmentary funerary inscription to Marcus Villius(?)
body:
1D(is) [M(anibus)]
2M(arcus) Vill[ius ---]
3vix(it) ạ[nnis ---]

1D[..]
2MVILL[...---]
3VIX.[....---]

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after autopsy;
  • 3: annis (or annos) is presumably abbreviated, but the precise form would be speculation.

English translation

To the shades of the underworld. Marcus Villius [---] lived for [---] years

commentary

There are no other attestations of this gens in Sicily. Bivona (1994) notes that there was a P. Villius Tappulus who was praetor in Sicily in 203 BCE, but correctly emphasises that this is 'too remote a past to be able to reasonably find a connection between the two'.

bibliography

  • 1994.0787 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 160 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • Fiorelli NSA 1883 302 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
